result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas R Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two, if not then perform 10 hours community service per week.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept including any relating to employment and housing. 
DNA sample w/ surcharge,

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: With huber for work, school, and community service. 45 days to report.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the two.
Absolute sobriety from drug and alcohol. May take prescription medications but only take as prescribed.
Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. AODA assessment w/ follow up.

records.addlTxt: BR 2 signed Stip

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 1:47pm
INCLUDES 15CF1198 & 16CF665
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty Lou Ann Bohn.
Date and time set for SAR in 15CF1198 & plea in 16CF665

SAR in 15CF1198:
Parties make stipulated recommendation on sentencing & all parties in agreement with Br. 1 proceeding with SAR, even though SAR is Br. 2 case
COURT ORDERS: Ct. 1 Possession of Narcotic Drugs- repeater- 3 years WSPS: 1 year IC, 2 years ES, concurrent to 16CF665 Ct. 1. CONDITIONS of ES: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, can take prescribed medications but only take as prescribed. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two. Pay CC. Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample. Deft is eligible for both prison programming- Substance Abuse & Challenge Incarceration. 140 days credit granted. Outstanding fees to be paid as part of ES. 

Plea in 16CF665:
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  
PLEA:
Ct. 1 Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine (<=3g)- second and subsequent offense >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 3 and half years WSPS: 1 and half years IC, 2 years ES, concurrent to 15CF1198 Ct. 1. CONDITIONS of ES: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, can take prescribed medications but only take as prescribed. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two. Pay CC. Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample. Deft is eligible for both prison programming- Substance Abuse & Challenge Incarceration. 132 days credit granted. 

Deft is remanded to MC Sheriff's Dept to be transported to Dodge Prison.

Case Called: 3:46 pm 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig for Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person with Atty James Kurszewski.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: 120 days MCJ with huber for work/school/community service with 45 days to report and 4 days jail credit; assessment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept including any relating to employment and housing; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; absolute sobriety; DNA sample and surcharge; CC.
